thread.title: Nevada Shuts Down Unlicensed Daily Fantasy Sports
thread.title_full: Nevada Shuts Down Unlicensed Daily Fantasy Sports

author: Sheppard Mullin Richter & Hampton LLP
title: Nevada Shuts Down Unlicensed Daily Fantasy Sports
text:
Nevada Shuts Down Unlicensed Daily Fantasy Sports more+ Contact 
To embed, copy and paste the code into your website or blog: <iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=000477ff-c1f7-4cd3-8231-3c1c11f5dd29" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"> 
In the latest regulatory salvo involving daily fantasy sports (DFS), the Nevada Gaming Control Board (NGCB) declared pay to play DFS to be gambling and has required DFS operators to cease and desist from operating in Nevada unless and until they are licensed in the state. 
The NGCB further stated that entities licenses to operate a sports pool may expose DFS in Nevada for themselves, but that they cautioned against entering into business association with entities
